name: "Brian: Portrait of a Dog" Multiple Choice Quiz | 'Family Guy'-  Season 1 | 10 Questions

questions.text: What TV show are the Griffins watching before the opening sequence?
questions.explanation:
Eight is Enough.

	The family sits down together to watch the "Eight is Enough" reunion only to discover that the show includes the father (Tom) smacking his daughter eight times.

questions.text: What is the name of Stewie's teddy bear?
questions.explanation:
Rupert.

	Stewie believes Rupert is a living thing, therefore he bosses him around and gives him orders to carry out every so often.

questions.text: Peter enters Brian in a dog show to help pay for what object?
questions.explanation:
Air conditioner.

	After a freak heat wave, the family finds it necessary to buy an air conditioner, but they don't have the money.  Peter asks Brian to be in a dog show at that point.

questions.text: When Brian is about to perform at the dog show, the announcer mispronounces his name.
questions.explanation:
True.

	When Brian is called up to perform, he is called "Brain".  Brian soon leaves the competition because he finds it demeaning.

Off the street.

	Brian was originally a stray dog cleaning windshields at intersections.  Peter brought him home where he remained.

questions.text: What does Peter buy the family to have them forget about Brian?
questions.explanation:
A cat.

	When Peter brings the cat home, it goes to the top of the refrigerator and throws fireworks at the family.  It also mauls Peter leaving him bloodied.

questions.text: When Brian is in the pound, who does Peter write to for help?
questions.explanation:
MacGyver.

	Peter sends MacGyver a drinking straw, a paper clip, and a rubber band.  MacGyver ends up shooting his own eye with it.

questions.text: What colour suit does Brian wear to his court hearing?
questions.explanation:
Blue.

	Brian wears a blue suit, a red tie, and a yellowish shirt to his hearing.  He ends up being able to go home after the whole ordeal.

questions.text: Lois makes counterfeit twenty dollar bills.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Lois makes counterfeit ten dollar bills.  This is revealed when everyone says they've been stealing ten dollar bills from each other, and when it comes down to Lois, it's shown that the bill wasn't even real.

questions.text: What TV show does the family watch at the end of the episode?
questions.explanation:
Murder, She Wrote.

	It's just a small tidbit of information.  Nothing about this fact is plot-changing.  It's a bit funny that the season began with the family watching TV, and it ended the same way.
